text.b: United Nations reform: measures and proposals
(b) The Millennium Assembly of the United Nations

page.text: The Acting President: I should now like to draw the
Assembly's attention to some revisions I made to the text
of the draft resolution which was contained in document
With regard to paragraph 1 of the draft resolution,
following consultations I had with member States after
sending the Assembly the draft dated 13 March 2000, I
have made a slight revision to the title of the overall theme
of the Summit, which now reads "The role of the United
Nations in the twenty-first century". This does not imply
any prejudice against any other operative paragraphs.
With regard to paragraph 3 of the draft resolution, the
original text did not reflect properly one of the provisions
of Article 21 of the Charter of the United Nations, namely,
that the General Assembly shall elect a President, not a
country, for each session. Consequently, I have replaced
twice in paragraph 3 the words "the country holding the
presidency" by the words "the country of the President".
We shall now proceed to consider draft resolution
I give the floor to the representative of the Secretariat.
Mr. Perfiliev (Director of General Assembly and
Economic and Social Council Affairs): By operative
paragraph 1 of draft resolution A/54/L.81/Rev.1, the
General Assembly would decide that the Millennium
Summit should be held from 6 to 8 September 2000 in
New York. In connection with conference servicing
requirements, the servicing of the plenary meetings would
be part of the normal servicing of the sessions of the
Assembly. No additional requirements would thus arise in
this respect.
By operative paragraph 2 of the draft resolution, the
General Assembly would decide that the Millennium
Summit would be composed of plenary meetings and of
four interactive round-table sessions, with each interactive
session to be held in concurrence with a plenary meeting.
